t: Then*p said the Lord*s unto me, Go yet, love a woman beloved of her friend, yet an adulteress, according to the love of the Lord*s toward the children of Israel, who look to other gods, and love flagons of wine.
So*p I bought her to me for fifteen pieces of silver, and for an homer of barley, and an half homer of barley:
And*p I said unto her, Thou shalt abide for me many days; thou shalt not play the harlot, and thou shalt not be for another man: so will I also be for thee.
For*p the children of Israel shall abide many days without a king, and without a prince, and without a sacrifice, and without an image, and without an ephod, and without teraphim:
Afterward*p shall the children of Israel return, and seek the Lord*s their God, and David their king; and shall fear the Lord*s and his goodness in the latter days.
